intro: Pichleria cruciata, commonly known as the crucifix pichleria, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive cruciform (cross-shaped) flowers, which are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant has small, ovate leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pichleria cruciata is considered a vulnerable species.
